content: Hi, I am doing a tooling update and currently I am getting a download speed of around 50 KiB/s from lean-lang.org, on a 1Gbps connection. This seems... off.

Also seems to happen from my browser when trying to download https://releases.lean-lang.org/lean4/v4.24.0/lean-4.24.0-linux.tar.zst so it would at the very least seem to be not confined to the command line tool. I would be grateful to know if it's just me or not.
Though weirdly wget appears to be fine... I am not sure what's going on there.
Note that these are just redirects to GitHub releases, so the title is misleading. It is of course still important to us to know when users have problems there.
Ah yes, I see that from the wget output. But yeah - absolutely zero idea why wget should be fine but lake and my browser would be painfully slow.
Elan uses libcurl though I don't know either if or how that could make a difference
Oh now wget is slow!
Going to try restarting my machine in case it's something stupid locally.
If only restarting the internet were an option sometimes :)
That appears to have exorcised the ghosts. I shall assume it was just a me problem unless anyone else experiences it.
Having this problem again today.
Could it be the Cloudflare outage?
No, it fixed on a restart again. So it's clearly something local to a degree, but I've no idea why it happens sometimes.
now, github is downâ€¦
(looks like it's back now)

I am experiencing the same issue:

[ðŸ§±] Ã— lake --version
info: downloading https://releases.lean-lang.org/lean4/v4.25.1/lean-4.25.0-linux.tar.zst
  2.3 MiB / 473.8 MiB (  0 %)  60.8 KiB/s ETA: 132 min 22 s

I have a 1gig connection, speedtest.net shows 500mbit.
(I am located in germany, maybe this is important)
Downloading the release in firefox directly on the github repo is also very slow, so this is clearly not a lake issue.

This is very weird: Before posting this, i also tried lake --version on my pc to see if this is an issue with my laptop and it was also very slow. I tried it a bunch of times (sometimes for several minutes) and was always slow. Then, on the last run, it just worked with normal download speeds (On my laptop).
I immediately tried it again on my pc and it also magically fixed itself there without me doing anything.
Yeah I find restarting generally fixes it for me. But it's still very annoying
Do you mean restarting the command or the device? Because I did not restart the computers... (And i had to restart the command on the laptop like 5 times before it worked :laughing: )
The device! But you may be having a different issue with the same symptom of course (or conversely it is the same underlying cause but with different incidental causes).
My issue does not seem to be local to my device, because it is slow again on my pc and my laptop (and i changed nothing). Maybe the network over at github is somewhat instable....
They may also be the case!

It's getting even funnier: I just left the command running at about 100 kib/s on my pc and after a minute or so, it just went up to 10 mib/s. (I immediately tried it on my laptop and it was also fast again). I think we will just have to wait unti they move the server at github a bit closer to the wifi.
